title: Sacramental Tree

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Ryerson Collection
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Twenty–Eighth Annual Exhibition of American Oil Paintings and Sculpture, Nov. 16, 1915–Jan. 2, 1916, cat. 94.

Art Institute of Chicago, First Exhibition of Works by Former Students and Instructors of the Art Institute of Chicago, Jan. 8–Feb. 7, 1918, cat. 139.

Metropolitan Museum of Art, A Memorial Exhibition of the Works by Arthur B. Davies, Feb. 17–Mar. 30, 1930, cat. 111 (ill.).

Corcoran Gallery of Art, Special Memorial Exhibition of Works by Arthur B. Davies, May 1–25, 1930, cat. 30.

Hartford, Wadsworth Atheneum, American Painting and Sculpture of the 18th, 19th, and 20th Centuries, Jan. 29–Feb. 19, 1935, cat. 49.

Pittsburgh, Carnegie Institute, Survey of American Painting, Oct. 24–Dec. 15, 1940, cat. 232. 

Utica, New York, Munson–Williams–Proctor Institute, Arthur B. Davies Centennial Exhibition, July 8–Aug. 26, 1962; Whitney Museum of American Art, Sept. 18–Oct. 17, 1962; Rochester Memorial Art Gallery, Nov. 30–Dec. 26, 1962, Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, Jan. 11–Feb. , 1963; Cincinnati Museum of Art, Feb. 25–Mar. 25, 1963; City Art Museum of St. Louis, Apr. 3–May 5, 1963; Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, May 23–June 23, 1963, cat. 51 (ill.).

Indianapolis Museum of Art, Perceptions of the Spirit in Twentieth Century American Art, Sept. 20–Novemeber 27, 1977; Berkely, University Art Museum, Dec. 20, 1977–Feb. 12, 1978; San Anotnio, Marion Koogler McNay Art Institute, Mar. 5–Apr. 16, 1978; Columbus Gallery of Fine Arts, May 10–June 19, 1978.

Grand Rapids Art Museum, Pioneers: Early Twentieth Century Art from Midwestern Museums, Sept. 17–Nov. 1, 1981, cat. 6.

Milwaukee Art Museum, Painters of a New Century: The Eight and American Art, Sept. 6–Nov. 3, 1991; Denver Art Museum, Dec. 7, 1991–Feb. 16, 1992; National Gallery of Canada, Apr. 16–June 7, 1992; Brooklyn Museum, June 26–Sept. 21, 1992.
provenance_text: With Macbeth Gallery, New York, 1915 [Inventory Records, box 111, folder 26, Macbeth Gallery Records, Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC]; sold to Mr. Martin A. Ryerson (1856–1932) and Mrs. Carrie Ryerson (1859–1937), Chicago, 1917; bequeathed to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1933.
